BiblioData.Title: Semiconductor laser device
BiblioData.Abstract: A semiconductor laser device, which has a protective film at an end surface thereof, is adaptable to demands for higher outputs or shorter wavelengths. The semiconductor laser device according to the present invention includes a dielectric film (110) on at least one end surface of an optical resonator (300), in which the dielectric film includes a first dielectric layer (111) and a second dielectric layer (112) comprised of the same elements and disposed in sequence from the end surface side of the semiconductor, the first dielectric layer including a layer made of a single crystal material and the second dielectric layer including a layer made of an amorphous material.

Claims.P: 1. A semiconductor laser device comprising:
an optical resonator; and
a dielectric film (110) on at least one end surface of the optical resonator,

wherein the dielectric film (110) comprises a first dielectric layer (111) and a second dielectric layer (112) that contain the same elements and are disposed in sequence from the end surface side of a semiconductor,
the first dielectric layer (111) is a reaction preventing layer that prevents a reaction between the semiconductor (200, 205, 210) and the dielectric film (110), and
the second dielectric layer (112) is a reflecting layer for a laser beam.
2. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 1,
wherein the first dielectric layer (111) includes a layer which comprises a single crystal material and the second dielectric layer (112), includes a layer made of an amorphous material.
3. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the first dielectric layer (111) has a lower refractive index than that of the second dielectric layer (112).
4. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 3,
wherein the second dielectric layer (112) has a larger thickness than that of the first dielectric layer (111).
5. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 3,
wherein a reflectance of the dielectric film (110) is 25% or less.
6. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 3,
wherein the dielectric film (110) has a reflectance of 20% or less when an oscillation wavelength of the semiconductor laser device is approximately 400 nm.
7. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 3,
wherein the first dielectric layer (111) and the second conductive layer (112) contain aluminum and oxygen as constituent elements.
8. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 3,
wherein the first dielectric layer (111) and the second dielectric layer (112) have approximately the same expansion coefficient.
9. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 1,
wherein the outermost layer of the dielectric film (110) comprises a nitride.
10. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 1, wherein the device comprises:
an optical resonator; and
a dielectric film (110) on at least one end surface of the optical resonator, wherein

the dielectric film (110) comprises a first dielectric layer (111), a second dielectric layer (112), and a third dielectric layer disposed on the end surface side of a semiconductor in sequence from the end surface side of the semiconductor;
the first dielectric layer and the second dielectric layer are comprised of the same elements;
the third dielectric layer (310) contains an element different from the element in the first dielectric layer and the second dielectric layer;
the first dielectric layer (111) is a reaction preventing layer which prevents a reaction between the semiconductor and the dielectric film; and
the second dielectric layer (112) is a stress relaxation layer which reduces stress between the first dielectric layer (111) and the third dielectric layer.
11. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 10,
wherein the first dielectric layer (111) and the second dielectric layer (112) contain oxygen.
12. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 11,
wherein the first dielectric layer (111) has a higher oxygen content than that of the second dielectric layer.
13. The semiconductor laser device according to claim 10,
wherein the outermost layer of the dielectric layer is a nitride.
14. An optical pickup device comprising the semiconductor laser device according to any one of claims 1 to 13.

15. A device for optically reading information stored on a media by condensing a laser generated by a semiconductor laser device on the media and detecting the laser reflected on the media so as to read the information, wherein
the semiconductor laser device is the semiconductor laser device according to any one of claims 1 to 13.
